column4: I was expecting ubuntu to play my dvd without problems, no deal, installing xine right now.
I got mine to play the dvds, but it's using the wrong sound card :P
add all the codecs (www.ubuntuguide.org)
what do you mean, you have more then one card
thanks for the tip
i have an onboard, which i use for my 5.1 speakers, and an audigy, for my 5.1 headphones
oh, got it. I have only one. hey thanks, I gotta go now, bbl, bye bye.
error reading nav packet, looks like it's an encrypted dvd.
say what?
installed what the section dvd playback capability, but totem gave me the same error, gxine shows the first screen asking for the language, when I choose one, comes the error.
try using xine :D thats what im using right now. apt-get install xine-ui
ok, installing
also reading a suse mailing list thread, someone says that this problem is the missing of libdvdcss 1.2.1 >
i thought you said you added that
but I did
libdvdcss2 is already the newest version.
same error with xine, error reading nav packet! :(
is your dvd dirty? i had the same error, and when i cleaned it, it worked :P
and that was about an hour ago
that's not the problem, it's the cdrom/dvd stupid cache.
you gota open and input the cd again. now it worked. thanks!
i guess thats it :)
hahah
cool, im gonna watch it, bye bye and thanks.
